'Alanine' (abbreviated as 'Ala' or 'A') . is an Î±-amino acid with the
chemical formula CH 3CH(NH 2)COOH. The L -
isomer is one of the 20 amino acids encoded by the genetic code. Its codons are
GCU, GCC, GCA, and GCG. It is classified as a nonpolar amino acid. L -
Alanine is second only to leucine in rate of occurrence, accounting for 7.8% of
the primary structure in a sample of 1,150 proteins. . D -
Alanine occurs in bacterial cell walls and in some peptide antibiotics.
